snippet: The military population is fluid. Service members join and leave constantly, and National Guard and reserve troops flow on and off active-duty rosters.
abstract: Analysis of Pentagon data shows that Defense Dept uses information that may underestimate rate of suicide in military, and that different methodology may yield military rate comparable to or higher than that of general public; government officials have commonly asserted that military suicide rate is lower than that of general public.

byline.original: By JAMES DAO and ANDREW W. LEHREN

lead_paragraph: The military population is fluid. Service members join and leave constantly, and National Guard and reserve troops flow on and off active-duty rosters.

headline.main: In Calculation of Military Rates, the Numbers Are Not All Straightforward
headline.print_headline: In Calculation of Military Rates, the Numbers Are Not All Straightforward
